title: Explosive Surge: US AI Bills in 2025 Already Shatter All of 2024 Records
body: Hold onto your hats, crypto and tech enthusiasts! The world of artificial intelligence is not just evolving in code and algorithms, but also in the halls of US lawmakers. We’re barely into 2025, and the legislative landscape around AI is already exploding. If you thought 2024 was busy with AI developments, think again. The sheer volume of US AI bills being introduced this year is nothing short of astonishing. Unprecedented Wave of US AI Bills: What’s Driving the Surge? According to MultiState, a consulting firm tracking these developments, a staggering 781 US AI bills are already pending in the US as of early March 2025. Let that sink in. This number eclipses the total of 743 AI bills proposed throughout the entirety of 2024. And to put it in even starker perspective, 2023 saw fewer than 200 such bills. We’re witnessing an unprecedented legislative frenzy around AI. just 66 days into 2025 and the number of artificial intelligence bills pending in the US now officially exceeds the total for ALL of 2024. 2024: 743 AI bills total for the year 2025: 781 AI bills in just 66 days pic.twitter.com/xrYPVDYgR1 — Adam Thierer (@AdamThierer) March 7, 2025 This legislative surge can be largely attributed to a vacuum at the federal level. The absence of a comprehensive national AI legislation framework, akin to the EU’s AI Act, is pushing individual states and lawmakers to take matters into their own hands. Congress has, so far, struggled to coalesce around a unified approach, leaving a patchwork of proposed regulations across the nation. Federal Inaction Fuels State-Level AI Regulation Spree Why is federal action on AI governance proving so elusive? Several factors are likely at play: Political Gridlock: Partisan divides in Congress make consensus on complex tech policy issues notoriously difficult. Industry Lobbying: The AI industry, with its diverse range of stakeholders, likely has varied and sometimes conflicting lobbying priorities, further complicating federal action. Lack of Urgency (Perceived): Despite the rapid advancements in AI, some lawmakers may not yet perceive the societal or economic urgency for comprehensive federal regulation, especially compared to more immediate political concerns. The Trump administration’s approach, while aiming to foster AI development, hasn’t translated into strong federal AI regulation . President Trump’s executive order in January focused on promoting AI innovation and removing ideological bias, but it stopped short of endorsing or pushing for major Congressional legislation. This hands-off approach from the executive branch further empowers state-level initiatives. What Does This Mean for the Future of AI and Crypto? For the crypto world, heavily intertwined with technological innovation and often utilizing AI in various applications, this explosion of 2025 AI bills has significant implications. Here’s what you need to consider: Compliance Complexity: A fragmented regulatory landscape across different states could create a compliance nightmare for crypto companies utilizing AI. Navigating 781+ potential laws is far more complex than dealing with a unified federal framework. Innovation Chilling Effect?: Overly restrictive or inconsistent state-level regulations could stifle AI innovation within the US, potentially pushing development and talent overseas. This could indirectly impact crypto projects reliant on cutting-edge AI. Opportunities for Clarity: Conversely, this flurry of legislative activity presents an opportunity for the crypto and AI industries to engage with lawmakers and shape regulations that are both responsible and innovation-friendly. Proactive engagement is crucial. Navigating the AI Regulatory Maze: Key Takeaways The sheer volume of pending AI legislation is a clear signal: AI is no longer a futuristic concept; it’s a present-day reality demanding immediate policy attention. Here are some key takeaways: Aspect Implication Volume of Bills Indicates urgency and widespread concern about AI, but also potential for regulatory fragmentation. Federal Inaction Drives state-level activity, leading to a potentially inconsistent and complex regulatory environment. Industry Engagement Needed Crypto and AI sectors must actively participate in legislative discussions to ensure balanced and effective regulations. Global Regulatory Landscape US developments should be viewed in the context of global AI regulation efforts (e.g., EU AI Act) to understand broader trends. The coming months will be critical in shaping the regulatory contours of AI in the US. For those in the crypto space, staying informed and engaged with these legislative developments is no longer optional – it’s essential for navigating the evolving landscape. title: Coinbase CEO Armstrong Says He'll Hire 1,000 in U.S. as Crypto Tide Turns
body: WASHINGTON, D.C. — As he walked out of the White House's crypto summit on Friday, Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong said his U.S. exchange is planning to hire a thousand people because of the policy progress the industry seems to be making at the beginning of President Donald Trump's second term. "It's only been, what, 50 days or something like that, and it's already created enough of a tailwind that we feel more confident in investing in the United States and growing our business here," Armstrong told CoinDesk. He said the hiring would take place this year. Coinbase, specifically, watched the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission completely abandon its pivotal enforcement action against the leading U.S. crypto platform. The company had been fighting the expensive legal dispute in federal courts over fundamental questions in regulatory jurisdiction over digital assets. That question is now in Congress' hands rather than continuing as a court fight and a drag on Coinbase's resources. Armstrong was among dozens of people crowded into the White House's State Dining Room for the first crypto summit with the White House, leading regulators and senior Republican members of Congress. The big news coming into the meeting was Trump's executive order the night before that called for the establishment of a bitcoin (BTC) reserve, which Armstrong endorsed. "You can't really have a better holder of this asset than the United States government," he said. "It's becoming a core piece of the financial system, and I think it's going to be a part of every diversified portfolio over time." Coinbase was a pivotal player during the 2024 election, putting tens of millions of dollars toward the crypto-focused political action committee Fairshake. He said Coinbase will keep backing the super PAC, which did "an incredible job" in boosting pro-crypto candidates. Bo Hines, the executive director of the President’s Working Group on Digital Assets, told CoinDesk that Friday's summit represented Trump's commitment to the industry. "The president made a promise that he's going to make this country the crypto capital of the planet, and we're well on our way in delivering that promise," he said in an interview after the close of the summit, in which the crypto reserve ideas played a significant part. "We were just with 30 or so of the greatest luminaries in the space, and I think everyone was tremendously pleased," he said. In answer to industry concerns that the bitcoin reserve isn't initially organized to include new investment, he pointed out that the secretaries of the U.S. Treasury and Commerce departments are ordered to weigh methods of buying bitcoins without burdening taxpayers, and "both of them are excited to look into ways to do it."

title: Nucleus dark web marketplace Bitcoin wallets reactivated after nine years
body: Bitcoin wallets associated with Nucleus Marketplace, an earlier known darknet marketplace for trading drugs, have been used for transactions after almost nine years of redundancy. According to Arkham Intelligence, on 7 March 2025, the wallets received $77.5 million in Bitcoin and transferred this amount to three new addresses. This is the first time since the platform suddenly vanished in April 2016 that funds have been moved. ANCIENT DARKNET MARKET WAKES UP AFTER 9 YEARS WITH OVER $400M $BTC Wallets belonging to Nucleus Marketplace woke up this morning after 9 years of inactivity, transferring $77.5M worth of Bitcoin to 3 new wallets. Nucleus Marketplace wallets still hold $365M BTC. New addresses:… pic.twitter.com/JtPXBK8Aec — Arkham (@arkham) March 7, 2025 Nucleus Marketplace was an online marketplace active from 2014 to 2016 that used Bitcoin to sell various prohibited products, such as drugs and other products. It abruptly vanished in rather murky circumstances, which ignited discussions of an exit scam or a hack. Before it disappeared, it was said to hold more than 5,000 BTC, valued at over $2.25 million at that time. As such, these remaining funds are estimated to be worth $365 million due to the appreciation of Bitcoin. According to the blockchain explorers, some of the addresses involved in the transactions include 1GGe3, which was last active in April 2016. The three new wallets this money is being sent to are “bc1qm8,” “bc1qm0,” and “bc1qsh.” Speculations on the resurgence The activation of this wallet has raised issues regarding the individuals behind it, as well as the motive for those operations. The individuals can be the original admins, police, hackers or anyone else who could have access to the private keys. title: Threatening AI Agents: Signal President Exposes Profound AI Privacy Risks
body: Are you ready to hand over your digital life to AI? Signal President Meredith Whittaker has issued a stark warning about agentic AI, painting a picture where convenience clashes head-on with critical AI privacy and security. At SXSW, Whittaker didn’t mince words, describing the burgeoning field of AI agents as potentially putting “your brain in a jar.” For crypto enthusiasts and tech-savvy individuals who value decentralization and data control, Whittaker’s concerns about agentic AI should resonate deeply. Let’s dive into why this advocate for secure communication is sounding the alarm on these seemingly helpful AI assistants. The Allure and the Abyss of Agentic AI: Understanding the Security Risks Imagine an AI that manages your daily digital grind – from booking concert tickets to coordinating with friends. Sounds like a dream, right? This is the promise of agentic AI . These intelligent systems are designed to act on your behalf, learning your preferences and automating tasks across the web. Whittaker illustrates this with a vivid example: Task Automation: AI agents can look up concerts, purchase tickets, add events to your calendar, and even message your friends about plans. Seamless Convenience: The goal is a hands-free digital experience, where the AI handles the mundane, freeing up your time. However, this convenience comes at a steep price, according to Whittaker. To perform these actions, agentic AI needs unprecedented access to your personal data and systems. This is where the security risks begin to surface. Deep Dive into the Privacy Issues: Why Agentic AI Raises Red Flags Whittaker meticulously breaks down the level of access agentic AI requires, revealing a concerning landscape of potential privacy issues : Access Point Privacy Implication Web Browser Control AI needs to navigate and operate your browser, potentially monitoring browsing history and online behavior. Financial Data Access Access to credit card information for purchases exposes sensitive financial details. Calendar and Messaging App Integration Access to personal schedules and communications reveals private conversations and plans. System-Wide Permissions “Root-like” access across your devices and databases means potentially unrestricted data visibility. Cloud Processing Data likely processed on remote servers, raising concerns about data storage, jurisdiction, and potential breaches. Whittaker emphasizes that this level of access, often “in the clear” due to encryption limitations in current models, creates significant privacy issues . The data needed to power these sophisticated agentic AI systems is unlikely to be processed locally on your device. Privacy Undermining: If privacy-focused apps like Signal integrate with agentic AI, the very privacy they offer could be compromised as the AI needs access to message content. Surveillance Model Amplification: Whittaker connects the rise of agentic AI to the existing “bigger is better AI paradigm,” built on mass data collection and surveillance, warning of further privacy erosion. Her concerns echo broader anxieties within the cryptocurrency and privacy communities about centralized data control and the potential for misuse of personal information. The promise of a “magic genie bot” shouldn’t blind us to the underlying security risks and privacy issues inherent in agentic AI . Stay Informed: Keep up-to-date on the developments in agentic AI and the ongoing discussions around its implications. Question Integration: Be critical of applications and services proposing agentic AI features, especially concerning data access and processing. Prioritize Privacy Tools: Continue to support and utilize privacy-focused technologies and platforms that minimize data collection and maximize user control. Advocate for Regulation: Engage in conversations and advocate for responsible AI development and regulations that prioritize user privacy and data security. Conclusion: A Call for Caution in the Age of Agentic AI Meredith Whittaker’s warning serves as a crucial reality check amidst the hype surrounding agentic AI . title: NASAA warns investors about rising crypto and AI-related scams
body: The North American Securities Administrators Association (NASAA) has identified crypto scams as one of the leading threats that retail investors must be aware of. The body, which comprises the securities regulators in all the US states, Canadian provinces, and Mexico, described it as a “critical threat.” According to its press release , it developed a list of major risks facing retail investors by surveying securities regulators in the US and Canada and examining what they spent the most time investigating. The survey showed that most of the scams used marketing tactics that manipulated investors’ emotions. While most scams involved marketing digital assets and AI investments, NASAA observed that the scammers used traditional social media platforms to target their victims. In terms of the prevalence of use, Facebook had 31.7%, text-based platforms like WhatsApp and Instagram had 31.3%, short-form video platforms such as Instagram reels and TikTok had 19%, while long-form video platforms like Vimeo and YouTube had 14.1%. As the Association noted, scams are prevalent on digital platforms because they are effective in reaching a wide audience as quickly as possible. This allowed these scammers to have access to a wide group of victims. AI functioned as both a scam tool and a tactic Meanwhile, the group also observed that scammers are increasingly relying on artificial intelligence tools to create content and graphics and deepfake audio and videos. It expects this to increase in 2025 and highlights the market for it. It wrote: “The bad actors are creating and selling AI-powered trading bots, selling equity in companies, purportedly developing an AI model, or perpetrating account takeover scams.” Beyond using it as a tool, NASAA noted that scammers are also promoting AI-related financial instruments. According to the president of the Association, Leslie Van Buskirk, AI technology’s rapid growth has given scammers new tools to steal from users Buskirk said: “AI investing is the latest technology to make waves in the investing landscape and fraudsters are pitching new investments that often have nothing to do with the latest tech developments and instead play on fear of missing out or get rich quick schemes along with other heightened emotions.” In order to protect investors from these scams, state securities administrators believe that registration at the state level is essential. The NASAA enforcement section committee co-chair Amanda Senn noted that investors need to confirm the registration status of anyone promoting a financial institution to them on the internet or social media before they invest. Crypto-related scams and losses continue to happen The statement from NASAA only confirms earlier opinions from other regulators, including the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), about the prevalence of financial scams connected to digital assets. Last month, the FBI revealed that it has saved almost $300 million in crypto-related investment fraud for thousands of victims. Interestingly, scams are not the only challenge that retail investors face. Even those who avoid investing in fraudulent crypto assets and buy real ones are still at risk of losing their funds to phishing attacks, hacks, and other security compromises like the Bybit hack that resulted in the loss of more than $1.4 billion worth of Ethereum. title: Trump’s Bold Bitcoin Stance: US Government to Become a Crypto Hoarder?
body: In a surprising turn of events that has sent ripples through the cryptocurrency world, former U.S. President Donald Trump made a powerful declaration at the White House Crypto Summit: “I will never sell Bitcoin.” This statement marks a significant shift in the U.S. government’s approach to digital assets, particularly Bitcoin , and has ignited discussions across the globe. For crypto enthusiasts and investors alike, this news is nothing short of monumental. But what exactly does this mean, and how will it reshape the future of Bitcoin and the U.S.’s role in the crypto ecosystem? Why Trump’s Bitcoin Announcement at the Crypto Summit is Monumental? Imagine the scene: the White House Crypto Summit, a gathering of industry leaders, policymakers, and innovators. Donald Trump , a figure known for his impactful pronouncements, steps up to the podium and states unequivocally, “I will never sell Bitcoin .” This wasn’t just a casual remark; it was a deliberate and strategic announcement with far-reaching implications. Here’s why this moment is being hailed as monumental: Shift in Government Policy: For years, the U.S. government, like many others, has been navigating the complexities of cryptocurrency regulation and management. The fact that a former U.S. President, with potential future political ambitions, is making such a pro- Bitcoin statement signals a potential paradigm shift in how the U.S. government views and handles digital assets. End to Bitcoin Sales: Trump specifically mentioned that the U.S. federal government had seized a substantial amount of Bitcoin – around 200,000 BTC – through legal actions. While a significant portion was reportedly sold under the Biden administration, Trump declared an end to this practice. This effectively removes a potentially large and unpredictable source of selling pressure from the Bitcoin market. New Accumulation Strategy: Perhaps the most intriguing part of Trump’s statement is his assertion that the Treasury and Department of Commerce will actively seek “new ways to accumulate more Bitcoin without burdening taxpayers.” This suggests a proactive approach to Bitcoin adoption by the U.S. government, moving beyond simply seizing and selling to strategically holding and potentially increasing its Bitcoin holding . The US Government’s Bitcoin Stash: From Seller to Holder? The narrative around the U.S. government and Bitcoin has been largely about seizures and subsequent sales. Understanding the context of this shift from seller to potential holder is crucial: Aspect Previous Policy (Pre-Trump’s Announcement) New Policy (Post-Trump’s Announcement) Bitcoin Seizure Government agencies seize Bitcoin through law enforcement actions. Continues (as part of law enforcement). Bitcoin Disposal Majority of seized Bitcoin was sold, particularly during the Biden administration. Cessation of Bitcoin sales from seized holdings, starting from the announcement date. Bitcoin Strategy No clear strategy for holding or leveraging seized Bitcoin beyond liquidation. Active strategy to explore accumulating more Bitcoin without taxpayer burden. Market Impact Sales of seized Bitcoin could contribute to market volatility and downward pressure. Holding seized Bitcoin and potential accumulation could reduce selling pressure and signal long-term confidence. This table highlights the transformative nature of Trump’s declaration. The U.S. government, once a consistent seller, is now signaling a potential transition to a Bitcoin holding strategy. This change in stance could have profound effects on market dynamics and investor sentiment. Trump’s Bitcoin Strategy: What Does ‘Accumulate Without Burdening Taxpayers’ Mean? Trump’s statement about accumulating Bitcoin “without burdening taxpayers” raises intriguing questions. How exactly might the U.S. government achieve this? Here are a few possibilities: Continued Seizures: Law enforcement seizures will likely remain a primary source of Bitcoin acquisition. By simply holding onto seized Bitcoin instead of selling, the government’s holdings will naturally increase over time as criminal activities involving crypto continue to be addressed. Strategic Investments (Indirectly): While direct taxpayer-funded purchases might be politically sensitive, the government could explore indirect methods. For example, revenue generated from fines, penalties, or asset forfeitures related to crypto crimes could be strategically reinvested into acquiring Bitcoin . Public-Private Partnerships: The government could potentially collaborate with private sector entities in the crypto space. This might involve partnerships that allow the government to earn or acquire Bitcoin through various mechanisms, without direct budgetary allocations. Mining Revenue (Hypothetical & Unlikely): Although less probable given current U.S. policy, in a more radical scenario, the government could even explore the possibility of utilizing seized crypto mining equipment or engaging in mining activities using forfeited energy resources. However, this is highly speculative and faces significant political and regulatory hurdles. The exact methods remain to be seen, but Trump’s commitment to Bitcoin accumulation is clear. This proactive approach signals a deeper engagement with the cryptocurrency space and a potential recognition of Bitcoin’s strategic importance. Is This a Game Changer for Bitcoin Adoption? The implications of the U.S. government becoming a significant Bitcoin holder are far-reaching and could indeed be a game changer for Bitcoin adoption globally: Validation and Legitimacy: When a major world power like the U.S. government signals its intention to hold Bitcoin , it lends significant validation to the asset class. This can help to overcome skepticism and encourage broader institutional and retail adoption. Reduced Market Volatility (Potentially): By removing the U.S. government as a potential seller, and perhaps even becoming a buyer, the supply-demand dynamics of Bitcoin could be positively influenced. Reduced selling pressure and increased demand could potentially lead to greater price stability and upward momentum over time. Increased Institutional Interest: Institutional investors often look to government policies and regulatory signals when making investment decisions. A pro- Bitcoin stance from the U.S. government could further incentivize institutional investment in Bitcoin and the broader crypto market. Geopolitical Implications: In a world increasingly shaped by digital technologies, nations are vying for leadership in the crypto space. The U.S. government embracing Bitcoin could position the U.S. as a more crypto-friendly nation, potentially attracting talent, innovation, and investment in the blockchain and cryptocurrency sectors. Challenges and Considerations of the US Government Holding Bitcoin While the prospect of the U.S. government holding Bitcoin is exciting for many, it’s important to acknowledge the challenges and considerations that come with such a significant move: Security and Custody: Securing a large Bitcoin holding is a complex undertaking. The government would need to implement robust security measures to protect against theft, hacking, and loss of private keys. Custody solutions, potentially involving hardware wallets and multi-signature setups, would be crucial. Regulatory Clarity: While Trump’s announcement is a strong signal, the regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies in the U.S. remains evolving. Clear and consistent regulations are needed to provide a stable framework for government Bitcoin holding and operations. Volatility Management: Bitcoin’s price volatility is a well-known characteristic. The government would need to develop strategies to manage the potential fluctuations in the value of its Bitcoin holding , especially for accounting and financial reporting purposes. Transparency and Accountability: Public scrutiny and accountability are paramount when it comes to government assets. Mechanisms for transparency regarding the government’s Bitcoin holding , transactions, and management practices would be essential to maintain public trust. Despite these challenges, Trump’s declaration marks a potentially transformative moment for Bitcoin and the U.S. government’s relationship with cryptocurrency. The shift from seller to holder could usher in a new era of government engagement with digital assets, with significant implications for the future of finance and technology. Conclusion: A New Chapter for Bitcoin and US Crypto Policy? Donald Trump’s announcement at the White House Crypto Summit – “I will never sell Bitcoin ” – is more than just a headline; it’s a powerful signal of a potential sea change in U.S. cryptocurrency policy. By committing to holding seized Bitcoin and exploring ways to accumulate more, the U.S. government could be on the verge of becoming a significant player in the Bitcoin ecosystem. This bold move could validate Bitcoin further, reduce market volatility, and attract greater institutional interest. While challenges remain, the implications of this shift are undeniably profound, potentially opening a new chapter for Bitcoin and the global crypto landscape. The world will be watching closely to see how this strategy unfolds and what impact it will have on the future of digital finance. title: Trump’s Bold Promise: Ending Biden’s Crypto War and Unleashing Crypto Businesses
body: Buckle up, crypto enthusiasts! The political winds are shifting, and the crypto landscape might be on the verge of a seismic change. Former U.S. President Donald Trump has thrown down the gauntlet, declaring an end to what he terms President Biden’s ‘war on crypto.’ This isn’t just political rhetoric; it’s a direct challenge to the current regulatory environment that many in the digital asset space view as stifling innovation and growth. Let’s dive into what Trump’s bold statements mean for the future of crypto regulation and, more importantly, for your investments. Decoding Trump’s Crypto Promise: What Does ‘Ending the War’ Really Mean? During his Crypto Summit speech, Trump didn’t mince words. He directly addressed the concerns of many in the crypto industry regarding regulatory pressure. He specifically called out ‘Chokepoint 2.0,’ a term that has become synonymous with the alleged strategy of regulators to indirectly target the crypto industry by pressuring banks to cut off services to crypto businesses. According to CoinDesk reports, this pressure has manifested in banks closing accounts of crypto firms and entrepreneurs, effectively creating roadblocks for fund transfers to and from cryptocurrency exchanges. Trump’s promise to ‘end the war’ and roll back ‘Chokepoint 2.0’ suggests a significant shift in approach. But what exactly could this entail? Here’s a breakdown of potential implications: Easing Regulatory Pressure: Trump’s administration could instruct regulatory bodies like the SEC and FinCEN to adopt a less aggressive stance towards the crypto industry. This could mean fewer enforcement actions and a more collaborative approach to rule-making. Unblocking Banking Access for Crypto Businesses: Rolling back ‘Chokepoint 2.0’ implies actively working to ensure crypto businesses have fair access to banking services. This could involve clarifying regulations for banks or even enacting policies that prevent discriminatory practices against crypto firms. Fostering Innovation: By reducing regulatory hurdles and improving banking access, Trump’s policies could aim to create a more favorable environment for crypto innovation and growth within the U.S. Crypto Regulation Under Biden: Understanding the ‘War’ To fully grasp the significance of Trump’s promise, it’s crucial to understand the context of the current regulatory landscape under President Biden. While the Biden administration hasn’t explicitly declared a ‘war on crypto,’ many in the industry feel that recent regulatory actions and pronouncements have been overly restrictive and even hostile. Here are some key aspects of the current crypto regulation environment often cited as evidence of this ‘war’: SEC Enforcement Actions: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), under Chair Gary Gensler, has taken a firm stance, asserting jurisdiction over a wide range of crypto assets, deeming many as securities. This has led to numerous enforcement actions against crypto companies for alleged securities violations. Operation Chokepoint 2.0 Accusations: As Trump mentioned, the ‘Chokepoint 2.0’ accusation centers around the idea that regulators are using banks to indirectly control the crypto industry. Critics argue that this tactic stifles legitimate crypto businesses and pushes innovation offshore. Lack of Regulatory Clarity: A persistent complaint from the crypto industry is the lack of clear and consistent regulatory guidelines. This uncertainty makes it difficult for businesses to operate compliantly and discourages investment. Treasury Department Scrutiny: The Treasury Department, particularly through FinCEN and OFAC, has also increased its focus on crypto, emphasizing anti-money laundering (AML) and sanctions compliance, sometimes leading to stringent requirements and enforcement. The Potential Benefits of a Crypto-Friendly Trump Administration for Crypto Businesses If Trump’s promise translates into concrete policy changes, the benefits for crypto businesses could be substantial. Imagine a scenario where regulatory burdens are eased, and banking access is normalized. What could this unlock? Reduced Compliance Costs: Less aggressive regulation and clearer guidelines could significantly reduce the compliance costs for crypto companies, freeing up resources for innovation and growth. Increased Investment and Capital Flow: A more welcoming regulatory environment could attract greater investment into the crypto space, both from institutional investors and venture capital. Easier banking access would also facilitate smoother capital flow within the industry. Job Creation and Economic Growth: A thriving crypto sector, fueled by reduced regulatory friction, could lead to significant job creation in areas like software development, cybersecurity, and financial services. This, in turn, could contribute to broader economic growth. Innovation and Technological Advancement: With less fear of regulatory crackdowns, crypto businesses would be more incentivized to innovate and develop new blockchain-based technologies and applications, potentially benefiting various sectors beyond finance. Navigating the Challenges: Will Trump’s Promise Be Fully Realized? While Trump’s promise offers a beacon of hope for the crypto community, it’s crucial to approach it with a balanced perspective. Political promises are often easier made than kept, and the regulatory landscape is complex and influenced by numerous factors. Here are some potential challenges and considerations: Regulatory Inertia: Changing the course of regulatory bodies is not an overnight process. Even with a change in administration, regulatory agencies have established processes and priorities that can be slow to shift. Political and Public Sentiment: Public and political sentiment towards crypto can be volatile. Negative events or scandals in the crypto space could easily derail efforts to ease regulation, regardless of political promises. Global Regulatory Landscape: Crypto regulation is increasingly becoming a global issue. Even if the U.S. adopts a more crypto-friendly approach, international regulations and compliance requirements will still play a significant role for global crypto businesses. The Role of Congress: While presidential actions can influence regulatory agencies, significant and lasting changes in crypto regulation often require legislative action from Congress. The political makeup of Congress and bipartisan support for crypto-friendly legislation will be crucial. Actionable Insights: What Should Crypto Investors and Businesses Do Now? Trump’s statements have injected a dose of optimism into the crypto market. But what practical steps should crypto investors and businesses take in response? Stay Informed: Keep a close watch on political developments and regulatory announcements related to crypto. Follow reputable news sources and industry publications to stay ahead of the curve. Engage with Policymakers: Support industry advocacy groups and initiatives that are working to educate policymakers about the benefits of crypto and advocate for sensible regulation. Prepare for Potential Regulatory Shifts: Businesses should review their compliance strategies and be prepared to adapt to potential changes in regulations, whether they become more lenient or stringent. Diversify and Manage Risk: While Trump’s promise is encouraging, the crypto market remains volatile. Diversification and prudent risk management are always essential investment strategies. Conclusion: A New Chapter for Crypto Regulation? Donald Trump’s pledge to end the ‘war on crypto’ marks a potentially pivotal moment for the digital asset industry. His focus on rolling back ‘Chokepoint 2.0’ and easing regulatory pressure resonates deeply with crypto businesses and investors who have long felt stifled by the current environment. While the path forward is uncertain and challenges remain, Trump’s bold promise injects a renewed sense of hope and anticipation into the crypto space. Whether this translates into a true ‘new dawn’ for crypto regulation remains to be seen, but the conversation has undoubtedly shifted, and the potential for significant change is now firmly on the table. title: US to audit crypto holdings after Trump establishes strategic Bitcoin Reserve
body: Before creating a Bitcoin reserve, the US government will have its crypto holdings audited to see how much it holds. This Thursday, President Trump directed for the establishment of a Bitcoin reserve and digital asset stockpile for the other currencies with crypto seized during legal proceedings. David Sacks believes the government has about 200000 BTC from its seizures White House Czar David Sacks insisted that a crypto audit is necessary given how they’ve never done one. According to Sacks, the government has captured over 400,000 Bitcoins in criminal and civil proceedings over the last ten years. He believes the government is still in control of about half of that. However, he says they cannot be certain of the total crypto holdings since they’ve never done a proper audit. According to Arkham Intelligence, the United States owns roughly $17.5 billion in Bitcoin and about $400 million worth of other digital assets in known digital wallets. Meanwhile, Trump’s executive order mandates that the Treasury and Commerce Departments find “budget-neutral strategies” to acquire Bitcoin for the reserve, limiting them to forfeited assets for now. The US government will also have seized crypto build its separate digital asset stockpile to avoid incurring extra costs in acquisitions. Sacks added, “With the reserve, the goal is long-term preservation. With the stockpile, the goal is responsible stewardship.” Nevertheless, he has compared the BTC reserve and the separate digital asset stockpile to “a digital Fort Knox for cryptocurrency,” likening it to the Kentucky military base that holds part of the country’s gold reserves. However, some crypto analysts and enthusiasts expected Trump to take bolder steps in asset acquisition and are slightly disappointed that the reserve holdings are limited to only seized assets. For instance, Charles Edwards of the Capriole Fund, a Bitcoin and digital asset hedge fund, stated that no active Bitcoin purchases mean that the reserve is just a “fancy title” for already existing assets within the government’s control. Trump will meet some key crypto leaders soon President Donald Trump insisted that he wanted to make the US the global crypto capital, and signing this executive order to create a BTC reserve was a step forward for the crypto industry. So far, the crypto industry has also seen impressive changes in regulations and across regulatory agencies where Trump appointed key crypto supporters. For instance, the Securities and Exchanges Commission has dropped or paused over 10 cases, including its case against crypto exchange Coinbase. Before Trump authorised the formation of a working group that would recommend and develop policies for cryptocurrencies, the group was also supposed to propose strategies for the government to establish crypto strategic reserves. Coinbase Global Inc. title: U.S. OCC Letter 1183 rescinds burdensome procedure, emphasizes permitted activities
body: A new United States Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) interpretive letter provides guidance for national banks’ activities with cryptocurrency. The agency emphasized that it permits a range of activities with crypto, and it confirms and reaffirms those activities. It also rescinds guidance from 2021 that banks found burdensome and discriminatory. The OCC’s Interpretive Letter 1183 of March 7 is the first to be issued under Acting Comptroller of the Currency Rodney Hood, who was appointed to his post on Feb. 11. Hood is quoted in a press release as saying that the letter ensures “Bank activities are treated consistently by the OCC, regardless of the underlying technology.” Hood further said he would “continue to work diligently to ensure regulations are effective and not excessive.” The OCC’s letter is about letters Interpretive Letter 1183 begins by saying Letter 1179 has been rescinded. That letter required national banks to notify their supervisory office if they intend to engage in any of the activities permitted in other letters. The supervisory office would then evaluate the banks’ adequacy and reply in writing to object to the proposed activities or confirm its nonobjection. That letter was issued in November 2021 under Hood’s predecessor acting comptroller Michael Hsu. The OCC has gained supervisory experience and realized those measures are no longer necessary, the new letter said. The rescission should reduce banks’ burden, encourage responsible innovation and enhance transparency. It also ensures that bank activities are treated consistently, regardless of the underlying technology. In 2020 and 2021, the OCC issued letters concerning banks providing crypto asset custody ( 1170 ), the use of dollar deposits to back stablecoins ( 1172 ) and the use of public blockchains to verify payments ( 1174 ). All of those letters were issued while Brian Brooks was comptroller. Brooks was a former Coinbase chief legal officer. Now the OCC will examine the activities described in those letters, Letter 1183 said. The letter backpedals on joint policy The press release for the new letter stated that the OCC has also withdrawn its participation in the joint statement on crypto asset risks. That document was issued by the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) and the OCC in January 2023. The joint statement came on the heels of the collapse of FTX and the rest of the events of the crypto winter. “It is important that risks related to the crypto-asset sector that cannot be mitigated or controlled do not migrate to the banking system,” it said. It went on to list eight specific risks. Banks can provide services to customers of any type, the statement read, but “based on the agencies’ current understanding and experience to date, the agencies believe that issuing or holding as principal crypto-assets … is highly likely to be inconsistent with safe and sound banking practices.” It’s still early for jubilation Caitlin Long, founder and CEO of crypto-native Custodia Bank and a long-time critic of banking regulation as it applies to crypto, was reticent in her praise of the new OCC letter. “Amid all the jubilation about the OCC news, #OperationChokePoint2.0 isn’t over until: 1. Fed & FDIC also rescind their anti-#crypto guidance, which is still in effect (Fed & FDIC were far more detrimental to crypto banking than OCC) & 2. @custodiabank has its Fed master account,” Long wrote on X. The OCC regulates national banks, while the Federal Reserve regulates state banks (which are otherwise overseen by state agencies and cannot open branches out of state). The FDIC regulates commercial banks, which are a subset of both state and national banks. Cryptopolitan Academy: Want to grow your money in 2025? body: Get ready for a seismic shift in the crypto landscape! The United States is signaling a major policy U-turn. After a period of intense regulatory scrutiny, U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has declared an end to the crypto crackdown , paving the way for a more innovation-friendly environment for digital assets. This groundbreaking announcement, delivered at the White House Crypto Summit, suggests a significant change in approach that could reshape the future of cryptocurrency in America and its global influence. Are you ready to explore what this means for you, for the market, and for the future of finance? Why the Sudden Shift Away From Crypto Crackdown? For months, the crypto industry has navigated a complex web of regulations, often feeling like authorities were putting the brakes on innovation. Secretary Bessent’s speech signals a clear departure from this stance. He openly criticized past policies, acknowledging that a heavy-handed crypto crackdown approach was actually hindering progress and pushing innovation overseas. This is a crucial admission and a welcome change for many in the digital asset space. But what exactly prompted this change of heart? Recognizing Stifled Innovation: The Treasury Secretary explicitly stated that previous regulatory measures were ‘stifling innovation.’ This suggests a growing understanding within the government that overly strict rules can push groundbreaking technologies and businesses away from the U.S. President Trump’s Pro-Tech Stance: The announcement is closely aligned with President Trump’s publicly declared pro-technology stance. This political backing gives weight to the policy shift and suggests a long-term commitment to fostering innovation in the digital realm. Global Competitiveness Concerns: It’s likely the U.S. is also considering its global standing. Other nations are actively embracing and regulating crypto, creating hubs for digital asset innovation. A continued crypto crackdown risked the U.S. falling behind in this crucial technological race. Stablecoins: The Unsung Heroes in Maintaining US Dollar Dominance A key highlight of Secretary Bessent’s announcement was the emphasis on stablecoins . He specifically identified them as crucial for maintaining the U.S. dollar’s global dominance in the evolving financial landscape. This is a powerful endorsement of stablecoins and their potential. But why are stablecoins so important in this context? Stablecoins , cryptocurrencies pegged to a stable reserve asset like the US dollar, bridge the gap between traditional finance and the volatile crypto world. They offer the speed and efficiency of blockchain technology while maintaining price stability. Secretary Bessent seems to recognize that: Global Transactions: Stablecoins facilitate faster and cheaper international transactions, potentially strengthening the dollar’s role in global commerce. Digital Dollar Infrastructure: They can be seen as a stepping stone towards a potential central bank digital currency (CBDC) or at least a key component of a future digital dollar ecosystem. Innovation Hub: By supporting stablecoins, the U.S. can become a hub for stablecoin innovation, attracting businesses and talent in this rapidly growing sector. What Does This Mean for Digital Assets? The shift away from a crypto crackdown and towards a more supportive regulatory framework has profound implications for the entire digital assets ecosystem. It’s not just about stablecoins; it’s about creating a fertile ground for all types of crypto innovation. Here’s what we can expect: Area Potential Impact Innovation Expect a surge in crypto startups and projects within the U.S. as regulatory uncertainty decreases. Investment Increased institutional and retail investment in digital assets as the market matures and gains legitimacy. Adoption Wider adoption of cryptocurrencies for payments, investments, and various applications as regulatory hurdles are eased. Job Creation Growth in the crypto industry will lead to new job opportunities in technology, finance, and related sectors. Navigating the New Crypto Regulation Landscape While the announcement signals an end to the crypto crackdown , it doesn’t mean a complete absence of crypto regulation . Instead, it suggests a move towards smarter, more innovation-friendly rules. What should businesses and individuals in the crypto space be prepared for? Clarity, Not Absence of Rules: Expect regulations to become clearer and more targeted, focusing on consumer protection and preventing illicit activities without stifling innovation. Collaboration: The government may seek more collaboration with the crypto industry to develop effective and balanced regulatory frameworks. Focus on Key Areas: Regulation might prioritize areas like stablecoins, exchanges, and DeFi to ensure market stability and investor confidence. Actionable Insights: Preparing for a Crypto-Friendly Future This policy shift presents significant opportunities. Here are some actionable insights to consider: For Businesses: If you’ve been hesitant to launch or expand your crypto business in the U.S. due to regulatory concerns, now might be the time to reconsider. Explore opportunities for innovation and growth within a more supportive environment. For Investors: Stay informed about evolving regulations and market developments. A clearer regulatory landscape could lead to increased market stability and new investment opportunities in digital assets . For Individuals: Educate yourself about cryptocurrencies and stablecoins . Understand their potential benefits and risks as they become more integrated into the financial system. A New Dawn for Crypto in the USA? Secretary Bessent’s announcement is a watershed moment. It signifies a potential turning point in the U.S. approach to cryptocurrency, moving from a period of intense scrutiny to one of cautious embrace. By ending the crypto crackdown and recognizing the strategic importance of digital assets and stablecoins , the U.S. is signaling its intent to remain a leader in technological innovation and global finance. This shift could unleash a wave of innovation, investment, and adoption, shaping the future of money and the internet as we know it. title: David Sacks says Trump’s mention of XRP, SOL, and ADA is being overanalyzed
body: As speculation surrounding President Donald Trump’s recent statement about creating a U.S. cryptocurrency strategic reserve has reached a fever pitch, White House AI and Crypto Czar David Sacks spoke out. Sacks attempted to reduce expectation and overinterpretation by noting that mentioning these particular altcoins did not mean any government-endorsed option or preference. Many cryptocurrency executives criticized the specific digital assets included in the report as too far-flung from crypto standards of development, institutional adoption, and decentralization seen in Bitcoin and Ethereum. Some analysts suggested that their addition was a sign the government had changed its approach and was preparing to back other blockchain networks. However, Sacks shot down those theories in an interview on Friday. “The president just listed the top five cryptocurrencies by market capitalization, so I think this is one of those moments where people are reading too much into this,” Sacks said. “There’s no secret motive behind it — he just mentioned the biggest names.” The market’s response to Trump’s comment was nonetheless stark. The name drop of XRP, SOL, and ADA resulted in explosive price movements, with some of these assets ripping up close to 70% over the weekend before pulling back. Such price volatility highlighted the outsized impact political statements and policy signals can have on digital asset markets. Federal government can’t account for all its crypto holdings Sacks said a complete audit was still needed to establish the government’s crypto holdings. He had no doubts that the U.S. government owned Bitcoin and thought there was some Ethereum. However, he noted that there was no clear answer to whether it also held other altcoins such as XRP, Solana, or Cardano. Source: Bloomberg That uncertainty is part of what Thursday night’s executive order required: a full tally of all the digital assets the U.S. government currently holds. The United States federal government has over 198,000 BTC holdings, and Bitcoin Treasuries estimate this to be worth around $17 billion at today’s prices. The order also establishes a U.S. Digital Asset Stockpile to manage non-Bitcoin digital assets acquired through criminal and civil seizures. However, it explicitly states that the government will not actively purchase additional cryptocurrencies for this stockpile beyond those obtained through legal recoveries. Federal government is not interested in selling its crypto holdings The executive order sets forth a new way of dealing with these digital assets rather than simply playing accountants. While the federal government may opt to sell some of its holdings, Sacks suggested other strategies, such as lending or staking the cryptocurrencies it owns and earning additional returns, could be used. Sacks said the executive order was meant to establish guidelines for responsible asset management. He said that the first step would be a complete audit and that digital assets would be transferred to a more secure account. The Treasury Secretary and their expertise would then administer a diversified portfolio to long-term custodial oversight to maximize the benefit for Americans. He also said the strategy may be as simple as staking certain assets for passive rewards, portfolio rebalancing to lower risk while gaining a larger return, or selling when appropriate. He said the Treasury Department could consider such options if they served the country’s long-term financial interests. With these policy developments playing out, the crypto industry’s eyes are now fixed on a highly publicized summit in Washington, D.C., where President Trump hosts several top Bitcoin and cryptocurrency executives. The discussions are likely to focus on regulatory approaches, market growth, and how blockchain technology is evolving in the U.S. economy. In the meantime, the market conditions are still turbulent. XRP and ADA have lost around 7% in the last 24 hours following their brief rally last weekend (according to The Block’s crypto price data). Solana (SOL), on the other hand, remained relatively more robust, recording a slight decline of 1.3%. The two leading cryptocurrencies, Bitcoin and Ethereum, have also suffered; Bitcoin has fallen 2%, while Ethereum has lost 2.7% during the same time frame. As the government’s crypto blueprint continues, traders, investors, and policymakers will watch how these assets are handled in the new U.S. Digital Asset Stockpile and whether other regulatory changes could affect the broader market. In essence, Capital One “de-banked” Plaintiffs’ Accounts because Capital One believed that the political tide at the moment favored doing so. In addition to the considerable financial harm that Plaintiffs and their affiliated entities suffered, Capital One’s reckless decision is part of a growing trend by financial institutions in the United States of America to cut off a consumer’s access to banking services if their political views contradict with those of the financial institution. Capital One’s conduct is but one example of a systemic, subversive industry practice that aims to coerce the public to shift and re-align their political views.” The move comes after Trump openly slammed both Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase. At a World Economic Forum session in January, Trump publicly criticized Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan and JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon. He accused them of denying services to conservatives, urging them to “open your banks” to those who have allegedly been unfairly kicked out of the banking system. title: Bitcoin Slides After Trump Signs Strategic Reserve Executive Order
body: Bitcoin and other top altcoins like ADA and Ripple’s XRP surged in price minutes after US President Trump issued a statement on a crypto strategic reserve. After languishing below $85k for days, Bitcoin climbed past $90k last Monday and briefly flirted with the $95k level. However, crypto’s hot streak was brief, making Trump’s latest statement a “sell on news” event. From $94,770 on March 3, Bitcoin dipped to as low as $82,681 on March 4. Leading altcoins also slumped with BTC, creating a ripple effect across the broader crypto industry. Today, Bitcoin is trading wildly between $84k and $91k, more than 10k below its all-time high. Related Reading: Billionaire Warns Of Financial Turmoil—Will Bitcoin Save Investors? What’s Up With The Bitcoin Drop? Bitcoin gradually recovered from a low of $83,000 last week and bounced back to $92k days before the planned White House Crypto Summit this Friday, March 7th. Trump’s latest pronouncement did not specify how the reserve shall be funded beyond what was already included in the US’ crypto holdings. Instead of clarity, the statement was just a commitment to retain crypto holdings, with no specifics on funding. The president’s disclosure on a possible stockpile spurred conversations and debates among analysts and critics. Many crypto holders and supporters backed the possible inclusion of SOL, XRP, and ADA. Stock broker and financial commentator Peter Schiff shared his thoughts on the plan, saying the US government should limit the assets included in the pile. He specifically identified “seized assets”, so the government should not buy additional SOL, ADA, XRP, and ETH. Other Crypto Experts Remain Supportive Of Bitcoin As Bitcoin and other leading altcoins struggle, other crypto personalities publicly announce their support for the project. For example, Metaplanet CEO Simon Gerovich argued that even though BTC is retreating, there’s no denying the importance of Trump’s latest executive order. Gerovich stated that this new order authorizes the Secretaries of Commerce and Treasury to draft a strategy for buying Bitcoin without burdening American taxpayers. He stated that the order is more aggressive and provides a plan for acquiring more crypto without affecting the national budget. Possible Paths To Acquire BTC Discussed Gerovich further explains that there are two ways the US government can acquire Bitcoins and set up a strategic stockpile: One, Trump can exercise his presidential power by using the Exchange Stabilization Fund, which has $39 billion in assets. Two, the president can rely on Congressional approval. The second option is in line with Senator Lummis’ Bitcoin Bill, where the US government will acquire 200k Bitcoins annually for five years. Related Reading: Bitcoin ‘Won’t Stop At $150K’ This Year, Research Firm Chief Says Lummis was one of the first personalities to comment on the latest EO. The senator mentioned that the latest order was just the beginning, and encouraged Congress to pass the Bitcoin bill. Crypto law expert MetaLawman also joined the conversations, supporting the Lummis plan by referencing the bill’s Section 5(a)(1)(A) which authorizes the US Treasury to buy 1 million Bitcoins in five years.
